regions.name: Annapurna Region
regions.description: The Annapurna region offers some of Nepal's most diverse trekking experiences, from easy family treks to challenging high-altitude adventures. Home to the world's tenth highest peak, this region features stunning mountain vistas, diverse ethnic cultures, and lush rhododendron forests.
regions.overview: Annapurna is Nepal's most popular trekking region, famous for its accessibility, comfortable teahouses, and breathtaking scenery. Treks range from gentle walks through traditional villages to challenging circuits crossing high mountain passes.
highlights: Annapurna Sanctuary - natural amphitheater of towering peaks
Thorong La Pass (5,416m) - highest trekking pass
Diverse landscapes from tropical forests to arid highlands

subcategories.name: Annapurna Foothills Trek for Families
subcategories.shortDescription: Gentle introduction to Himalayan trekking suitable for families with children
subcategories.fullDescription: This family-friendly trek takes you through picturesque villages, rhododendron forests, and offers stunning views of the Annapurna range. The trails are well-maintained and accommodation is comfortable with family rooms available. Perfect for first-time trekkers and families looking to experience the Himalayas without strenuous climbs.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Kathmandu
itinerary.description: Arrive at Tribhuvan International Airport, transfer to hotel, trek briefing

itinerary.title: Fly to Pokhara & Trek to Dhampus
itinerary.description: Morning flight to Pokhara, drive to Phedi, trek to Dhampus village

itinerary.title: Dhampus to Pothana
itinerary.description: Gradual climb through forests to Pothana, Annapurna views

itinerary.title: Pothana to Australian Camp
itinerary.description: Short trek to Australian Camp, panoramic mountain views

itinerary.title: Australian Camp to Kande
itinerary.description: Descend through forests to Kande village

itinerary.title: Kande to Pokhara
itinerary.description: Short trek to road head, drive to Pokhara, lakeside relaxation

itinerary.title: Pokhara Exploration
itinerary.description: Free day for Pokhara sightseeing, boating, or relaxation

itinerary.title: Fly to Kathmandu
itinerary.description: Morning flight to Kathmandu, free for shopping and exploration

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: Transfer to airport for international departure

subcategories.physicalRequirements: Good health, able to walk 4-5 hours daily on moderate trails

subcategories.name: Annapurna Sanctuary Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Classic trek to the base of Annapurna mountains, surrounded by towering peaks
subcategories.fullDescription: The Annapurna Sanctuary Trek takes you to the heart of the Annapurna range, offering breathtaking views of Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Machhapuchhre (Fishtail), and Hiunchuli. This trek combines diverse landscapes from subtropical forests to alpine meadows, culminating at Annapurna Base Camp.
highlights: Natural hot springs at Jhinu Danda

subcategories.name: Annapurna Circuit Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: One of the world's classic treks crossing Thorong La Pass
subcategories.fullDescription: The Annapurna Circuit is considered one of the world's best treks, offering incredible diversity of landscapes, cultures, and ecosystems. The trek crosses Thorong La Pass at 5,416m and takes you through subtropical forests, high-altitude deserts, and traditional villages.
highlights: Kali Gandaki Gorge - world's deepest gorge

subcategories.name: Nar Phu Valley Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Remote trek to hidden valleys with Tibetan culture
subcategories.fullDescription: The Nar Phu Valley Trek takes you to remote valleys that were opened to trekkers only in 2002. This trek offers a unique combination of high peaks, remote villages, and ancient Tibetan culture. The area is less crowded and provides an authentic wilderness experience.

subcategories.name: Jomsom Muktinath Trek for Families
subcategories.shortDescription: Family-friendly trek in Lower Mustang region with spiritual significance
subcategories.fullDescription: This family-friendly trek follows the Kali Gandaki River valley to the sacred Muktinath Temple. The trail offers relatively easy walking with gradual ascents, making it suitable for families. The trek combines natural beauty with cultural and spiritual experiences.
highlights: Muktinath Temple - sacred to both Hindus and Buddhists
Kali Gandaki Valley - world's deepest gorge
Natural diversity from subtropical to desert

regions.name: Everest Region
regions.description: The Everest region, also known as Khumbu, is home to the world's highest peak - Mount Everest (8,848m). This region offers some of the most spectacular trekking experiences with close-up views of the world's highest mountains.
regions.overview: Trekking in the Everest region takes you through the homeland of the Sherpa people, past ancient monasteries, and into the heart of the Himalayas. The region features stunning glacial valleys, high mountain passes, and rich Buddhist culture.

subcategories.name: Everest View Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Shorter trek with magnificent views of Everest without going to base camp
subcategories.fullDescription: The Everest View Trek is perfect for those with limited time who still want to experience the magic of the Everest region. This shorter trek takes you to Namche Bazaar and Tengboche, offering spectacular views of Everest, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam.

subcategories.name: Everest Base Camp Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: The ultimate trek to the base of the world's highest mountain
subcategories.fullDescription: The Everest Base Camp Trek is one of the world's most famous treks, taking you to the foot of Mount Everest. This challenging trek passes through Sherpa villages, Buddhist monasteries, and offers breathtaking mountain views throughout the journey.

subcategories.name: Gokyo and Everest Base Camp Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Combine Gokyo Lakes with Everest Base Camp for the ultimate Everest experience
subcategories.fullDescription: This comprehensive trek combines the best of the Everest region - the turquoise Gokyo Lakes and the iconic Everest Base Camp. The route includes crossing Cho La Pass and offers spectacular views from Gokyo Ri and Kala Patthar.
highlights: Gokyo Lakes - six turquoise glacial lakes

subcategories.name: Three Pass with Everest Base Camp Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: The ultimate Everest adventure crossing three high passes and visiting base camp
subcategories.fullDescription: This is the most comprehensive and challenging trek in the Everest region, crossing three high mountain passes (Renjo La, Cho La, and Kongma La) while also visiting Everest Base Camp. It offers complete 360-degree views of the Everest Himalayas.
highlights: Three high passes: Renjo La, Cho La, Kongma La

regions.name: Langtang Region
regions.description: The Langtang region, closest to Kathmandu, offers spectacular trekking through beautiful valleys, alpine meadows, and high mountain scenery. Known as the 'Valley of Glaciers', it's rich in Tibetan culture and biodiversity.
regions.overview: Langtang is perfect for trekkers seeking a Himalayan experience without the crowds of Everest or Annapurna. The region features diverse landscapes, from subtropical forests to glacial valleys, and offers authentic cultural experiences with Tamang and Tibetan communities.

subcategories.name: Langtang Valley Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Beautiful trek through the 'Valley of Glaciers' close to Kathmandu
subcategories.fullDescription: The Langtang Valley Trek takes you through one of Nepal's most beautiful valleys, often called the 'Valley of Glaciers'. The trek offers stunning mountain views, diverse flora and fauna, and rich Tamang culture, all within easy reach of Kathmandu.

subcategories.name: The Gosaikunda Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Sacred trek to holy alpine lakes in Langtang region
subcategories.fullDescription: The Gosaikunda Trek takes you to a series of sacred alpine lakes that are pilgrimage sites for both Hindus and Buddhists. The trek offers beautiful mountain views, rhododendron forests, and cultural insights into local religious practices.

subcategories.name: Helambu Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Cultural trek through traditional Sherpa and Tamang villages near Kathmandu
subcategories.fullDescription: The Helambu Trek is a cultural journey through traditional Sherpa and Tamang villages, offering beautiful scenery and authentic cultural experiences. It's one of the most accessible treks from Kathmandu, perfect for those with limited time.

subcategories.name: Tamang Heritage Trail Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Cultural immersion trek through traditional Tamang villages with hot spring relaxation
subcategories.fullDescription: The Tamang Heritage Trail is a relatively new trek that focuses on cultural immersion in traditional Tamang villages. The trek offers beautiful mountain views, cultural experiences, and ends with relaxation in natural hot springs.

subcategories.name: Ganjia La Pass Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Challenging trek crossing high passes in Langtang region
subcategories.fullDescription: The Ganjia La Pass Trek is a challenging adventure that crosses high mountain passes in the Langtang region. This trek offers spectacular mountain views, remote trails, and a true wilderness experience away from the crowds.

subcategories.name: Bhairav Kunda Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Sacred trek to holy Bhairav Kunda Lake in Langtang region
subcategories.fullDescription: The Bhairav Kunda Trek takes you to a sacred lake that is an important pilgrimage site for Hindus. The trek offers beautiful mountain views, diverse landscapes, and cultural insights into local religious practices.
highlights: Bhairav Kunda Lake - sacred pilgrimage site

regions.name: Manaslu Region
regions.description: The Manaslu region, home to the world's eighth highest peak, offers a remote and authentic trekking experience. This restricted area requires special permits and provides a true wilderness adventure with rich Tibetan culture.
regions.overview: Trekking in the Manaslu region is a true adventure, taking you through remote villages, across high mountain passes, and into areas with rich Tibetan Buddhist culture. The region is less crowded than Annapurna or Everest, offering a more authentic experience.
highlights: Mount Manaslu (8,163m) - world's eighth highest peak

subcategories.name: Manaslu Circuit Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Complete circuit trek around Mount Manaslu, crossing Larkya La Pass
subcategories.fullDescription: The Manaslu Circuit Trek is a spectacular journey around the world's eighth highest mountain. This challenging trek crosses the high Larkya La Pass and takes you through remote villages, diverse landscapes, and rich Tibetan Buddhist culture.
highlights: Diverse landscapes from tropical to alpine

subcategories.name: Manaslu Circuit TSUM Valley Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Extended trek combining Manaslu Circuit with sacred Tsum Valley
subcategories.fullDescription: This extended trek combines the classic Manaslu Circuit with the sacred Tsum Valley, offering the ultimate Manaslu region experience. The trek takes you to remote Tibetan Buddhist communities, ancient monasteries, and spectacular mountain scenery.

subcategories.name: Tsum Valley Trek
subcategories.shortDescription: Cultural trek to the sacred Tsum Valley, known as the 'Hidden Valley'
subcategories.fullDescription: The Tsum Valley Trek takes you to a sacred Himalayan valley that was closed to foreigners until 2008. This cultural trek offers deep immersion in Tibetan Buddhist culture, ancient monasteries, and traditional villages in a remote setting.
